CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1960, pg. 10, reads: "Plan Polio Clinics - Strong support from local organizations is in order of the day in planning the new series of polio clinics for the Homewood-Brushton area. At a recent meeting held to make final plans for the series of clinics were, left to right: Mrs. Angeline Lezzi, health chairman of the Larimer Parent-Teachers Association; Mrs. Ora Sims, field secretary of the Homewood Community Improvement Association; Public Health Nurse Nancy Donnelly of the Allegheny County Health Department; Dr. Sterling J. Robinson, chairman of the Homewood Chamber of Commerce's Professional Division; Peter E. Bohr, principal of Lincoln School; Mrs. T. R. Richardson, president of the Belmar Parent-Teacher Association; George Abromatz, president of the Homewood Chamber of Commerce, and Rev. James A. Spelman, Holy Rosary Church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Polio clinic planning committee seated from left: Angeline Lezzi, Shirlee N. Lewis holding sign reading "Get your polio shots now and play it safe," Ora Sims, Nancy Donnelly; standing: Sterling J. Robinson, Peter E. Bohr, T. R. Richardson, George Abromatz, and Rev. James A. Spelman
